name: Peppers Salt Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent place to stay for quick getaway or longer holiday. Buffet breakfast was great, cocktails were yum and heaps of free movies to watch. Pools were relaxing and you felt like you were in fiji. Close to beach, resturants, pub.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Peppers Salt Resort for Valentines weekend and truly loved it. We live on the Gold Coast and wanted to go somewhere close but feel like we'd gotten away from it all. The location at Salt Beach next to the fishing village of Kingscliff gave us that .. and whilst we thought we'd wander the village and generally do the things locals do, we ended up just staying at the resort instead. Our 1 bedroom apartment gave us enough space to relax, enjoy the wine we'd bought and the treats that were left for us in the room. The apartment and resort are well equipped .. free inhouse movies, free internet (not that we used that!), free bikes and tennis. Conclusion .. we loved it and next time will make sure we do a 3 or 4 night stay so we can enjoy Peppers AND Kingscliff.
reviews.title: Perfect for a relaxing or romantic weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect from Peppers @ Salt. Firstly, I didn't even know that "Salt" was a town, but after going through random roads we eventually stumbled upon this magnificent area.
reviews.title: Unknown Paradise Escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Salt is beautiful, and is built as a resort town. The Peppers hotel, is ideally situated in the middle of all the action. Its close to the beach, food, and an IGA.
reviews.title: Great for a lazy holiday
Batteries recharged!
reviews.text: The rooms are nice and clean. The free on-demand movies is an added bonus, considering it normally costs $7+ per movie. The pool is well maintained, and is quite relaxing. All in all, it was a great trip - and we will probably go back for a weekend retreat.

I had a few nights down here with my husband and his parents. We got a great deal through the Peppers website for a 2bed with plunge pool that included breakfast for 4 and unlimited free movies and thought it was a great deal. The resort was lovely and new, the pool was great and the SAlt village had everything you needed. We hired bikes and went into Kingscliff which was an easy and pleasant ride. The breakfast was busy but really good variety and we tried the Italian restaurant in the village for dinner which was great. The pub was also lively and good value for money meals. Beach was beautiful too altho did see a little guy get attacked by some nasty blue bottle stingers which did not look pleasnat. All in all the perfect destination for an extended family weekend away. Also very easy to drive to from Brisbane which is a bonus
reviews.title: Lots of space in 2bedroom with plunge pool, great beach and pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a suite during the Queensland labour day weekend. I have experienced Peppers before and that is why I booked. This place drags the name down, it is more like a mid-range beach hotel than a boutique luxury spa. Actually those two words boutique and luxury have no place in this review!!! Upon arrival an older female on reception was extremely abrupt, curt and snappy with me. I shuddered at the amount of money I was to pay for my weekend only to be treated on arrival like a prisoner arriving at a state penetentiary. This terrible start was rescued by the well equipped suite room. These rooms are almost like a small 1 bedroomed apartment. There is a wc with shower and seperate bath, a kitchenette with microwave, toaster, kettle and stove hobs. There is a work desk where you can plug into the internet, this leads to the living area with tv, stereo and sliding doors to the balcony. The tv has a function where you can watch all the latest dvd releases but the general programming provides only basic channels and a poor quality signal. Our balcony had a nice view out towards the ocean. However well equipped the room was it was also dirty in equal measure. It appeared to not have been cleaned properly for a couple of weeks with dust everywhere, streaks all over the kitchen, a very dirty bathroom with dirt and dust in every crevice. So at this point I had been at Salt for 15 minutes, had been treated badly by an obnoxious women on reception and then been bouyed by the rooms facilities but disappointed again by it's dirtyness.
reviews.title: Dirty, over priced, extremely badly managed, not remotely 5 star.

reviews.text: We accepted that the standard of cleanliness would not change from room to room and unpacked and went for a walk. A young fair haired guy on reception (sorry forget his name) saved the day with his attention to us. We had a couple of questions about the resort and he was extremely helpful and pleasant - note to Peppers, more staff like him and less of the old hags because when you are claiming 5 star status it is always going to be your staff that define you.
reviews.title: Great spot for family holiday

reviews.text: Ambling from resort to beach we found that it was the kind of location we wanted for our weekend break. It has a choice of eating options from seafood to thai to barfood all within a minutes walk from the hotel door. It has an IGA store that is well equipped if you are on a short break. There is also coffee shops, a bottle shop and a bar. The bar lacks an atmosphere but is fine for a quick beer, they also have most sports you might be looking for on tv. The lifeguard patrolled beach is very clean and perfect for a dip, we found the water warm enough for a good long swim. All in, I like the location, it is relaxing and you do not have to get back in the car to find a restaurant or grab a beer or get to the shops.
reviews.title: Not 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back in the hotel the following are nice amenities - the lagoon pool is nice, specifically because it is heated but the problem of a poor cleaning staff is again evident with poolside furniture very dirty and empty bottles and glasses everywhere.
reviews.title: Valentines Day getaway

reviews.text: Desperate for a short break and longing to explore more of the beauty and majesty of Northern NSW we decided on Peppers as the perfect base for a family weekend.
reviews.title: Another professional, peaceful Peppers

likes.liked: — value for money and great pool scene
likes.disliked: — not enough time to enjoy all the amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed not long after it opened we were also curious to see if it had retained its standards and the professionalism that the Peppers franchise is renowed for.
reviews.title: Getting better...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try as we might we could find fault nowhere. Our 2 room suite - booked through Wotif at $360 per night - represented tremendous value for money. It is essentially a spacious fully self-contained 1 bedroom suite with an interconnecting Hotel Room. Cleverly designed to cater to both the Conference market ( Hotel room alone),Couples ( 1 bed suite) and families ( both rooms) the outer door can be closed to ensure both doors open into a small internal foyer enabling them to interconnect. The Hotel room alone could be described as small but it is very comfortable and more than adequate for the price.
reviews.title: WORST resort experience - stay away

likes.disliked: — pretty much everything, especially lack of noise insulation

reviews.title: Worst resort experience in a long time...
reviews.text: For a seaside resort the fixtures and fittings in the rooms have lasted remarkable well and the decor is still as chic and stylish as if it was just done yesterday. The beds are excellent and all the extras from bathbombs in the spa bath to King size pillows and complimentary chocolates are still on offer.

The pool at this resort is one of our favourites. Busy during the day it can be difficult to snare a Daybed but we had no trouble securing a couple of Loungers under the palm trees and we were quickly served excellent cocktails and milkshakes from the bar. The pool is a clever blend of half square, modern lines and decking and half sandy lagoon and is deep and expansive. Imagine our delight when we returned from adinner each night k to find the pool empty and completely at our disposal.
reviews.title: Great hotel, terrible restaurant!

likes.liked: — The hotel itself was quite good, the service was above average.
likes.disliked: — The service we received at Roughie's restaurant was the worst we have ever received at a restaurant.

reviews.title: Not quite up to usual standard.
reviews.text: I've stayed at this property a few times. It's always been great, but time was a little disappointing. Yes, they were busy, but I don't think this is a reason to "drop the ball".

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Twice we were sent to the wrong room. Then we were let into someone else's room (coz the key was apparently faulty), only to find we'd walked into an occupied room, with someone's wallet and laptop on the table. Yikes.
reviews.title: Great relaxing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once sorted out, things were ok, but it seemed like this property had lost some of it's sheen.
reviews.title: A spicy little number!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort was very relaxing.
reviews.title: A nice getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the resort for a get away to relax and had a wonderful time. Though the resort pool was full of kids the beach (which is amazing and just across the park) was patrolled , clean and was very uncrowded. There are also plenty of smaler plunge pools available.
reviews.title: A perfect weekend away

likes.disliked: — Forgot to mention the creaky bed!!!!!

description: Discover the ultimate in beach holiday accommodation at Peppers Salt Resort & Spa on Kingscliff Ocean Beach. Peppers Salt Resort & Spa offers beautifully decorated, hotel rooms and self-contained suites, from one to three bedrooms, moments from South Kingscliff Ocean beach - one kilometre of stunning ocean frontage. A Golden Door health spa, restaurants, bars, family activities and all the facilities of Salt Village are just a short stroll away.
